title: Breakfast Joints
name: Breakfast Joints
description:
A Map by Baostar

Where to rise and dine in Orange County.

properties.name: Harbor House Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  16341 Pacific Coast Hwy., Sunset Beach, CAOpen 24 hours and breakfast served anytime! More than 25 omelettes to choose from; great location near the beach.

properties.name: Adele's Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  111 Avenida Palizada, San Clemente, CA\'50s-style café in historic Old City Plaza with patio tables set around a beautiful Spanish fountain. Adele greets many of her customers by name and with a hug. The enchiladas and eggs are good and filling. Kids can enjoy a Mickey Mouse-shaped pancake (.95).

properties.name: Alice's Breakfast in the Park
properties.description: Posted by Baostar    6622 Lakeview, Huntington BeachA charming restaurant by the lake which offers indoor or outdoor dining with breakfast and lunch served till the afternoon. The cinnamon rolls here are great and have a slight orange taste. There are lots of ducks and squirrels around the lake, including a nearby dog park.

properties.name: Arthur's
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 240 N. Tustin, Orange, CAThick-cut bacon, perfectly melted cheese, fresh tortillas. If the cartoon character Strawberry Shortcake could be eaten, it would taste like the melt-in-your-mouth strawberry waffle at Arthur’s. Try “Arthur’s OJ,” an orange juice blend similar to Orange Julius drinks.

properties.name: Benjie's
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 1828 N. Tustin Ave., Santa Ana, CANot only a great place to get Kosher deli favorites like matzo ball soup and corned beef on rye: the breakfast omelettes, served all day, are divine - fluffy and crammed with quality meat, veggies and cheese. Only nit: pancakes and French toast only served until 11 a.m. weekdays, 1 p.m. weekends!

properties.name: Blackboard Bistro
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 1198 Pacific Coast Hwy., Seal Beach, CAYummy made-from-scratch fruit preserves, eggs Benedict hollandaise sauce and salsa. Try the fluffy buttermilk pancakes and the flavor-packed ground turkey hash (laced with green chiles).

properties.name: Bonjour Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  24633 Del Prado Ave., Dana Point, CATasty omelettes, crepes, quiches, French toast and cappuccino. Pleasant sidewalk dining, service with attitude.

properties.name: Break of Dawn
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 24351 Avenida de la Carlota, Laguna Hills, CADinner-like indulgence in the morning, but it\'s not too overpowering for breakfast. You can get dishes like a plate of tender, fall-off-the-bone short ribs alongside eggs poached in red wine. If that\'s not enough for you, hidden underneath is a mushroom-filled crepe. Breakfast menu includes Cinnamon Sticky Bun, Blueberry Waffle, Crème Brûlée French Toast, with raisins on a cinnamon brioche surrounded by a creamy custard made with Kahlua for those who need a bigger sugar fix.

properties.name: Cappy's Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  5930 Pacific Coast Hwy., Newport Beach, CAA West Newport landmark since 1957. Large breakfast menu of all the staples done well, large portions and a casual, beachy feel.

properties.name: Champagne Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  3901 Irvine Blvd., Irvine, CA 92603A nice spot to sit and read the newspaper on a Sunday morning.

properties.name: Coyote Grill
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 31621 Coast Hwy., Laguna Beach, CASpecializes in cuisine of Baja Mexico, and the breakfast choices include a great chicken machaca, huevos rancheros, enchilada and eggs. Fresh tortillas. Plus an ocean-view patio and friendly service.

properties.name: Durango Mexican Grill
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 730 E. Imperial Hwy., Brea, CAThis fast-casual Mexican eatery is a hidden gem in Brea, offering authentic food, modest prices and friendly service from the Villalaba family. In addition to indoor seating, Durango shares an outdoor patio with Diedrich, which makes a winning combination during breakfast hours or on a laid-back evening. The breakfast burritos, omelettes and huevos rancheros rock. Most are served with chilaquiles or potatoes to die for, and you can grab some coffee from Diedrich, which shares a patio with Durango.

properties.name: Haute Cakes Caffe
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 1807 Westcliff Drive, Newport Beach, CA 92660Tucked among children\'s boutiques and salons, Haute Cakes Caffe has earned a reputation for great pancakes. They serves up three large golden buttermilk cakes with butter and maple syrup on the side. And for a long time, only the plain (albeit delicious) cakes were available. Country French bakery bread is browned and spread with creamy mascarpone cheese; it\'s then dotted with fresh raspberries and drizzled with honey to create a sort of deconstructed toast and jam. Their favorite salad combines romaine with crumbled Maytag blue cheese, thinly sliced apples and candied pecans in a champagne vinaigrette.

properties.name: Heidelberg Pastry Bistro
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 1100 S Coast Hwy, Laguna Beach 92651The Heidelberg is a casual place located right on Pacific Coast Highway. There are some indoor seats and a few outdoor tables on a patio just above the street. You will get traffic noise here, but it\'s also the perfect people-watching locale. It\'s a local favorite and packed all the time, especially for breakfast.

properties.name: Hennessey's Tavern
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 34111 La Plaza, Dana Point, CAHearty and tasty fare, like corned beef hash and eggs, burger patty and eggs and Irish Country Platters (a heaping platter of home-style potatoes topped with two eggs, ranchero sauce and melted cheeses). Pancakes, oatmeal and Cap\'n Crunch French Toast, too.

properties.name: I Love Bagels
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  28985 Street of the Golden Lantern, Laguna Niguel, CAThis small shop offers 22 bagel varieties, as well as deli sandwiches, a kids\' menu, and a dairy case full of interesting cream cheese flavors like sun-dried tomato and basil, jalapeno, and walnut raisin. They open from 6 a.m.-2 p.m. Monday-Friday, 6 a.m.-1 p.m. Saturday-Sunday.

properties.name: Katella Deli
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 4470 Katella Ave., Los Alamitos, CAFluffy, salad-plate-sized buttermilk hotcakes, perfect (not runny) scrambled eggs and omelettes, fresh-baked bagels and the most flavorful, non-greasy corned beef hash we\'ve tasted.

properties.name: La Galette Creperie
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 612 Avenida Victoria, San Clemente, CA17 crepes available, croque monsieur and gelato - need I say more?

properties.name: Mollies Famous Café
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 32033 Camino Capistrano, San Juan Capistrano, CABreakfast served all day. The breakfast menu of old-fashioned favorites includes fruit and cereal, eggs of all kinds (omelettes, Eggs Benedict, huevos rancheros, or served with everything from bacon to trout), waffles, French toast and pancakes. Good-sized portions, fast and friendly service.

properties.name: Nick's Deli
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 223 Main St., Seal Beach, CAThe breakfast burritos at Nick\'s are legendary, and you can get them all day (7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Monday-Friday, until 5 p.m. Saturday and until 4 p.m. Sunday). For .50, you get a huge flour tortilla stuffed with eggs, chorizo, bacon (baked, not pan fried), potatoes and cheese. Vegetarian and machaca versions, too.

properties.name: O'Malley's
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 140 Main St., Seal Beach, CAEnjoy the Irish Benedict (eggs Benedict with a corned beef hash of perfectly pan-fried shredded beef dotted with bell peppers) and other hearty fare near the fireplace.

properties.name: Omelette Parlor
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 179 E. 17th St., A, Costa Mesa, CAThey know eggs, and the huge Belgian waffles are perfect - crispy edges, fluffy inside. Not the best place for pancake lovers, though - only basic "Paddy Cakes" offered.

properties.name: Original Pancake House
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 1418 E. Lincoln Ave., Anaheim, CAA nearly overwhelming menu of pancakes, Belgian waffles and omelettes, all prepared perfectly (and good coffee, too!).

properties.name: Pacific Whey Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  This european-inspired cafe serves breakfast with the highest quality and freshest ingredients, and they make their food from scratch, which is exactly how I like it.

properties.name: Plum's Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  369 E 17th, Costa Mesa, CA 92627A trendy breakfast place in the corner of a non-descript shopping mall. A local secret that is not so secret anymore - they\'re always a line here. The Dutch Babies and coconut french toasts are my favorites.

properties.name: Pop's Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  112 E. 9th St., Santa Ana, CACharming little old-style diner that serves up fat omelettes, great Irish potatoes, French toast offered grilled or deep fried.

properties.name: Ramos House Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  31752 Los Rios St., San Juan Capistrano, CA, 92675Gourmet food served up in the rustic charm of a house built in 1881. You’ll be hooked on the crab hash, the melt-in-your-mouth beignets and their version of French toast: the banana maple pain perdu with toasted walnuts and cream. Be prepared to wait an hour or more to be seated for the popular weekend brunch.

properties.name: Shore House Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  520 Main St., Huntington Beach, CABreakfast served all hours: Great fluffy omelettes, yummy potatoes. And a major plus with 24-hour service in Seal Beach.

properties.name: Side Street Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  1799 Newport Blvd Ste A105, Costa Mesa, CAThe banana pancakes are yummilicious. Big menu, small place – be prepared to wait on weekends. Family-run, with a loyal following.

properties.name: Sugar Shack Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  213 Main St., Huntington Beach, CAGreat location on Main Street, just over a block from the beach and Huntington Pier – but as a result, it’s always packed. Favorite gathering spot for local politicos. All the breakfast staples are excellent – even the oatmeal.

properties.name: The Bread Crumb Ohana Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   19079 Beach Blvd., Huntington Beach, CAEverything\'s tasty and reliable at this family-run place: fluffy omelettes, friendly service.

properties.name: The Cottage
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 308 N. Coast Hwy., Laguna Beach, CA, 92651Quality breakfast classics - fluffy eggs, omelettes and pancakes - served up in a charming old house near the beach.

properties.name: The Koffee Klatch
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  1440 So. Coast Hwy., Laguna Beach, CA 92651The Klatch offers the cushiest couches and chairs where you sit and enjoy a cup of coffee, food and desserts. It also has free Wi-Fi and and Internet kiosks built into some of the tables. The atmosphere is a dimly lit place with eclectic décor of rouge walls, sheer, flowing drapes, box-shaped couches and chairs, hanging candelabras, and framed vintage posters on the wall. Locals use Koffee Klatch as a convenient meeting place. It\'s also a hangout for the girls of the reality show "Laguna Beach: The Real Orange County," if you care about that.

properties.name: The Neighborhood Cup
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  1 Journey, Aliso Viejo, CA 92656True to its name, this neighborhood coffeeshop/cafe is a hot spot for locals - owner Jennifer Secofsky and staff often greet customers by name. The menu offers coffee drinks, sandwiches, soups and salads. Enjoy your beverage or meal at the cafe\'s tables or settle in on the comfy velvet sofas. The cafe offers weekly family-related events like board game nights, swing dancing, car shows, poetry readings, live music and more.

properties.name: The Waffle Lady
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  107 Via Pico Plaza, San Clemente, CAThe family-owned eatery has every waffle imaginable, all tasty: chocolate, bacon, M&M, coconut and jalapeño cheddar. There’s plenty of other breakfast, lunch and dinner foods to choose from, too.
